content.question: Rostowâ€™s stages of development can easily be applied to countries such as the United States and Japan, but not so easily to countries such as the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Bolivia, because the theory

choices.label: is predicated on less developed countries receiving financial assistance from more developed countries
places emphasis on developed nations having less developed nations to exploit for resources
ignores unevenness in development across the globe
does not take into account the interdependence of places and regions
highlights the semiperiphery as the most successful in development

content.answer: places emphasis on developed nations having less developed nations to exploit for resources

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain the strengths, weaknesses, and limitations of different geographic models and theories in a specified context.
